SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models

Class Grocery

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models.Grocery
All Implemented Interfaces:
FoodItem
public class Grocery extends Object implements FoodItem
A class representing a grocery item, which is a food item that can be consumed. A grocery item consists of a name, category, unit, and one or more GroceryBatch objects.

The class provides methods for adding and removing grocery batches, and decreasing the amount of a grocery item to reflect user consumption. The class also provides methods for retrieving grocery batches, the total amount of a grocery item, and for sorting grocery batches by expiration date.

The class implements the FoodItem interface, which provides methods for getting the name, category, and unit of a food item.

Since:
V0.1
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen

  • Constructor Details

    • Grocery

      public Grocery(String name, String category, String unit, GroceryBatch batch) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs a new grocery object. The method validates the provided parameters and initializes the grocery object with the provided values if they are all valid, by calling the setter methods. If any of the provided parameters are null or an empty string, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      name - specifies the name of the grocery item. Name must not equal null or an empty string.
      category - specifies the category of the grocery item. Category must not equal null or an empty string.
      unit - specifies the unit of the grocery item. Unit must not equal null or an empty string.
      batch - specifies the GroceryBatch object of the grocery item. Must not equal null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameters violate the constraints specified.

    • setTotalAmount

      private void setTotalAmount(double newAmount) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the total amount of the grocery item. If the new amount is less than or equal to zero, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException. Otherwise, it sets the total amount of the grocery item to the provided value.
      Parameters:
      newAmount - specifies the new amount of the grocery item. Amount must equal a positive number or zero.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the amount equals zero or a negative number.

    • addBatch

      public void addBatch(GroceryBatch batch) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a new batch to the grocery item. If the batch is null, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException. Otherwise, the method adds the batch to the list of batches, and updates the total amount of the grocery item. The list of batches is sorted by expiration date when updated.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • consume

      public void consume(double amount) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Consumes a specified amount of the grocery item. The method iterates through the batches of the grocery item, and consume the amount from the batches that expire first. The method will remove the batch if the amount to consume is equal to the amount of the batch. If the amount to consume is greater than the amount of the batch, the method will remove the batch entirely and update the remaining amount to consume for the next batch. If the amount to consume is less than the amount of the batch, the method will subtract the amount from the batch.
      Parameters:
      amount - specifies the amount of the grocery item to consume. Amount must equal a positive number.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the amount to consume is greater than the total amount of the grocery item, or if the amount to consume is zero or a negative number.

    • sortBatches

      private void sortBatches()
      Sorts the batches of the grocery item by expiration date, in ascending order.

    • toReadableString

      public String toReadableString()
      Returns a reader-friendly string representation of the grocery item.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the grocery item. Including name, category, amount, unit, expiration date, and all batches.
